title: 103_hr2343
content: SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. The Act titled "Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993" restricts the export of unprocessed timber from state and public lands. Amendments include changes to Section 491 of the Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Act of 1990. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 restricts the export of unprocessed timber from public lands by issuing an order effective from June 1, 1993, to December 31, 1995. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 restricts the export of unprocessed timber from public lands by changing the definition of "total annual sales volume" to "annual sales volume in that State of unprocessed timber originating from public lands". The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 restricts the export of unprocessed timber from public lands by prohibiting the purchase of such timber for substitution of exported unprocessed timber. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 prohibits the export of unprocessed timber from public lands for substitution with timber from private lands in a State, unless certain conditions are met. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 prohibits the export of unprocessed timber from public lands for substitution with timber from private lands in a State. The Secretary of Commerce is responsible for determining the species, grades, and geographic origin of prohibited timber and administering the prohibitions. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 prohibits the export of unprocessed timber from public lands for substitution with timber from private lands in a State. The Secretary of Commerce is responsible for determining the species, grades, and geographic origin of prohibited timber and administering the prohibitions. The Secretary may issue regulations to ensure compliance and cooperate with other agencies. Authorized State Programs are exempt from certain regulations if they have their own enforcement programs in place. The Forest Resources Conservation and Shortage Relief Amendments Act of 1993 allows Governors to submit state programs to the Secretary of Commerce for approval, implementing a prohibition on exporting unprocessed timber from public lands within the state. The approved programs must ensure that the prohibited timber represents the species, grades, and geographic origin of the state's total timber sales program. The Secretary of Commerce will approve state programs submitted by Governors unless they lead to the export of unprocessed timber from public lands in violation of the law. Approved programs can be administered by the State in place of federal regulations. The Governor of a State with a program meeting certain requirements can notify the Secretary of Commerce to administer and enforce the program in place of federal regulations for a 9-month period. The program must be approved by the Secretary. The Secretary can approve contracts for the purchase of unprocessed timber from public lands, with exceptions for contracts entered into before specific dates and contracts allowing exports of unprocessed timber before October 23, 1992. This section does not override section 7(i) of the Export Administration Act of 1979. SEC. 3. MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT. Monitoring and enforcement of timber acquisition from public lands is amended to include reporting requirements for those acquiring unprocessed timber subject to an order issued by the Secretary of Commerce. Reporting to the Secretary of Commerce is mandatory in the prescribed form. The paragraph requires individuals transferring unprocessed timber from public lands subject to an order by the Secretary of Commerce to provide a written notice identifying the timber's origin and receive a written acknowledgment and agreement from the recipient to comply with regulations. The paragraph outlines the requirements for transferring unprocessed timber from public lands under an order by the Secretary of Commerce, including providing written notices, acknowledgments, and agreements. Civil penalties are imposed for willful violations of export restrictions on unprocessed timber. The Secretary may assess civil penalties for violations related to exporting unprocessed timber from public lands, with a maximum penalty of $500,000 per violation or 3 times the value of the timber. Exports from states with their own enforcement programs are exempt. The Secretary of Commerce can impose civil penalties for violations regarding the export of unprocessed timber from public lands, with exceptions for states with their own enforcement programs. SEC. 4. SEVERABILITY. If any provision of this Act or the amendments made by this Act is held invalid, the remainder of the Act and amendments shall not be affected.
